Answer one question. Refer closely to the works of at least two poets you have studied.

1.   Poetry is often concerned with powerful responses to different subjects. Looking at the work
     of at least two poets you have studied, examine how effectively poets use language to
     convey these responses to the reader.


2.   Referring closely to the work of at least two poets you have studied, show how, through their
     use of language and style, they have made you perceive things in a different way.


3.   Referring closely to the work of at least two poets you have studied, discuss the ways in
     which they use figurative language and form to present the complexity in human relations to
     the reader.


4.   Poetry can often be about pain. In the work of at least two poets you have studied, show
     how their poetry gives voice to suffering.


5.   With close reference to at least two poets you have studied, explore the purposeful ways in
     which the poets have written their poetry to establish a prevailing mood or different moods for
     their reader.


6.   How do at least two poets you have studied deal with the subject of spirituality in their poetry?
